page.title: 15LIFE ON A DEVON FARM 1
page.content: The house is cob and stone built and heated by wood burning appliances. It has main electricity and water, but the old hand pump is still workable and the water is like crystal. Employment is farming and there are very poor prospects for female work, needing to travel at least 4 miles for jobs. There are only 2 buses to Okehampton a week and one each a month to Holsworthy and Exeter so for everyday use cars are a life-line. Children are transported to both primary and secondary school, but youngsters learn to drive as soon as possible. The telephone is also really essential with children scattered for work and men away on farm contracting. Sunday tends to be "home" day with much inter-visiting of friends and relations and always "plate pasty" for tea with trifle to follow.
